description: The International Law and Human Rights program is offered at The Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

university: University of the West of England (UWE Bristol)
description: The Law programme at University of the West of England (UWE Bristol) is highly regarded by both branches of the profession, and many solicitors and barristers choose this route into law, building on the knowledge they have obtained in another academic field to establish a successful legal career.

The specialist LLM in Criminal Litigation at at City, University of London is the first postgraduate degree course in the UK to be devoted exclusively to criminal litigation. It concentrates on the principles that lie behind the criminal justice system and the need to place those principles in a critical and comparative context.

This Criminology and Criminal Justice course from Keele University is designed for all those who want to acquire a thorough understanding of the more recent and often complex trends and developments in crime, criminal justice, and governance more broadly.

If you have a law degree or GDL and wish to train as a solicitor, we offer three options including an LPC MSc in Law, Business and Management to make you business ready with this Legal Practice Course (LPC) - full-time course at The University of Law.

This International Law programme from The University of Edinburgh is ideally suited to those wishing to specialise in public international law and offers you a firm foundation in the fundamentals of the international legal system and international relations.

The Law - Part-time programme offered by The University of Law is designed for non-law graduates who want to gain a legal qualification at Master’s Level. This is an online course, with the option to study over one or two years.

The University of Arizona Global will help international students like you stay on track toward an U.S. degree, wherever you are in the world. course: Graduate Diploma in Law (GDL) Online - Full-time

The aim of the Master of Arts in Human Rights Law and Practice from University of Malta is primarily to provide a multi-disciplinary and in-depth teaching of human rights law.

course: Graduate Diploma in Law (GDL) Online - Part-time

The Criminal Justice and Criminal Law programme at the University of Leeds  will enable you to develop a sophisticated knowledge of current issues in criminal justice, criminology and criminal law in the UK, Europe and across the globe. It combines cutting-edge compulsory modules with a wide range of optional modules allowing you to tailor your degree to your own particular interests.

course: Master of Arts in Criminology (Preparatory Programme)
description: The aim of this Master of Arts in Criminology (Preparatory Programme) from University of Malta  is designed predominantly to deliver a serious of study units that cover the advanced themes in criminology and to prepare students for a research based approach required at masters level thus contributing to a richer understanding of criminology.

course: Online Master of Laws in International Business Law
description: The Online Master of Laws in International Business Law at Robert Kennedy College is the prime management qualification for lawyers and managers wishing to strengthen their legal knowledge; research indicates that the LL.M is a catalyst for individuals with strong career aspirations.

course: Global Environment and Climate Change Law
description: The Global Environment and Climate Change Law programme offered by The University of Edinburgh is designed to equip you with an advanced, multidisciplinary knowledge of the legal issues and techniques related to environmental protection, with special emphases on climate change and the marine environment.

university: School of Built Environment and Engineering

course: Human Rights Studies in Politics, Law and Society

The University of Technology Sydney Juris Doctor is an internationally recognised graduate-entry qualification for non-law graduates. course: European Criminal Justice in a Global Context
description: The European Criminal Justice in a Global Context programme at Utrecht University links the national criminal justice systems of the EU Member States to EU criminal law, EU constitutional law, including fundamental rights law, and EU administrative law.
